alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Livingston; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 17 at 4:49PM CDT until June 17 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Baton Rouge Parish in southeastern Louisiana... West Central Livingston Parish in southeastern Louisiana... East Central West Baton Rouge Parish in southeastern Louisiana... * Until 800 PM CDT. * At 449 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Baton Rouge, Baker, Denham Springs, Port Allen, Oak Hills Place, St. Gabriel, Walker, Merrydale, Westminster, Inniswold, Shenandoah, Brownfields, Old Jefferson, Village St. George, Greenwell Spring, Watson, Gardere and Baton Rouge Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 155 and 168. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 14. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; Livingston; West Baton Rouge
